definition: to specialize in (a particular product or service)/monopoly
for a particular person, occasion, purpose/focused on one thing/special/expert/particular (to sth)/concentrated/specialized
camp/barracks/battalion/to build/to operate/to manage/to strive for

sentences.english: Come this way. My brother has a shop.
sentences.chinese: 跟我來，我兄弟有專營店。

sentences.english: There Weichai power franchise stores, China's heavy truck engines two franchise stores.
sentences.chinese: 另設濰柴動力專營店，中國重汽發動機專營店兩個。

sentences.english: There Weichai power franchise stores, China's heavy truck engines two franchise stores.
sentences.chinese: 另設濰柴動力專營店，中國重汽發動機專營店兩個。

sentences.english: The size of company grew rapidly, and immediately after WWII 450 franchises were opened.
sentences.chinese: 二戰之後極快的發展了450家專營店。

sentences.english: How long might the restructuring and sale of Citigroup take, with its huge global entanglements? What damage to its franchise and operations might be done in the process?
sentences.chinese: 這樣的過程中其專營權和行動又可能受到何種損害？

sentences.english: This master franchise will oversee operations in Negri Sembilan and Kuala Lumpur.
sentences.chinese: 這個專營權將掌握在森美蘭監督行動和吉隆坡。

sentences.english: We wish to introduce ourselves to you as a stateoperated corporation dealing exclusively in light industrial goods.
sentences.chinese: 我們是專營輕工產品的國營公司。

sentences.english: His restaurant has two storeys , sells orthodox western-style food, and most famous as its Pizza.
sentences.chinese: 小店分上下兩層，專營正宗西餐，尤以比薩最出名。

sentences.english: Dealers in the U. S. are privately-owned franchises.
sentences.chinese: 在美國，汽車經銷商都是私有專營企業。

sentences.english: Automobile Concession Shop is one of the Automobile Trade Buildings.
sentences.chinese: 獨立式汽車品牌專營店是汽車貿易建築的組成之一。

sentences.english: And they specialise in selling overpriced novelty goods, really.
sentences.chinese: 他們專營高價的新奇的商品，真的。

sentences.english: Specialised in all kinds of scrap iron, cut length bar lorry service.
sentences.chinese: 專營新舊五金廢鐵，剪便長短花，圓鐵支羅哩服務。

sentences.english: Old franchises birthed promising new sequels that turned hours of play into days.
sentences.chinese: 老了有前途的新專營權續集將發揮天小時。

sentences.english: Both Chinese firms specialise in network infrastructure, but they also make handsets.
sentences.chinese: 這兩家中國公司專營網絡基礎設施，同時也製造手機。

sentences.english: An enterprise specializing in the import and export of publications and stationery.
sentences.chinese: 是一個專營圖書及文化用品的進出口貿易公司。

sentences.english: This company manily runs foreign trade business.
sentences.chinese: 這家公司專營外貿業務。

definition: running/operation (of airport, bus service, business etc)
to add to existing facilities or services
to engage in (business etc)/to run/to operate
to be in operation/to do business/(of train, bus etc) to be in service/operation/service
to procure (for an enterprise etc)/to purchase
